alert.note: Alert for Clark; Jefferson; Scott (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 9:20AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Jefferson, northeastern Clark, southeastern Scott, northeastern Oldham, Trimble and northern Henry Counties through 945 AM EDT... At 920 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bedford, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Jefferson, northeastern Clark and southeastern Scott Counties in south central Indiana, northeastern Oldham, northern Henry and Trimble Counties in north central Kentucky, including the following locations... Oldham, Campbellsburg, Sulphur, Monitor, Owen, Paynesville, Lacie, Vesta, Wises Landing and Turners Station. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
